disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Moderate ozone air pollution forecast valid from Wednesday 22 June to end of Wednesday 22 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Good sunshine all day on Wednesday.<br/><br/>A light breeze and northerly air-feed is forecast throughout the day. The northerly air should ensure temperatures don't get too high in continuous sunshine. Nevertheless, with light winds, temperatures in the mid twenties and above are expected.<br/><br/>In these temperatures, it's likely ozone levels will reach 'Moderate' sometime from Wednesday afternoon. A running 8-hourly mean of 'Moderate' ozone is required to classify ozone as 'Moderate' according to the Daily Air Quality Index (DAQI). Despite incoming air not being expected to carry much by way of imported pollution, thereby limiting the availability of the precursor chemicals required for ground-level ozone to form. 'Moderate' ozone is a possibility at background sites on Wednesday.<br/> <br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' for the following pollutants throughout the forecast period:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Thursday 23 June to end of Thursday 23 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: A sunny start to Thursday but with cloud developing.<br/><br/>An ongoing northerly air-feed continues with a light breeze locally. The northerly air-feed and cloud cover later on, should prevent it getting too hot, with temperatures expected around the mid twenties. In addition, incoming air is not expected to carry much by way of imported pollution, thereby limiting the availability of the precursor chemicals required for ground-level ozone to form.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' for the following pollutants throughout the forecast period:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide
